item.title: U.S. Delivers Drones, Missiles to Philippines, Top Officials Speak on South China Sea
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: 2020-11-26 18:20:43 Source: Global Military Times Report The U.S. delivered weapons worth nearly $33 million to the Philippines this week, including 100 wire-guided missiles, 12 thermal imaging systems, 24 500-pound bombs and an unmanned surveillance aircraft, the State Department said, according to the U.S. Army’s Stars and Stripes newspaper of 25 March. Robert O’Brien (center) inspects a TOW-2A missile system in Manila. A $14.79 million ScanEagle unmanned aerial vehicle was turned over to the Philippine Navy on Wednesday to enhance its maritime surveillance and border security capabilities, according to a statement released the same day by the U.
